OS [e.g. iOS, Linux]: WinPython 3.7.1 (v3.7.1:260ec2c36a, Oct 20 2018, 14:57:15) [MSC v.1915 64 bit (AMD64)] on win32 Version [e.g. flair-0.3.2]: flair-0.4.2, torch-1.0.1

I have never tried cross-OS serialize-deserialize, but it looks like using concrete paths such as PosixPath or WindowsPath isn't compatible:
If you want to manipulate Windows paths on a Unix machine (or vice versa). You cannot instantiate a WindowsPath when running on Unix, but you can instantiate PureWindowsPath.
<denchmark-link:https://docs.python.org/3/library/pathlib.html#pure-paths>https://docs.python.org/3/library/pathlib.html#pure-paths</denchmark-link>
So the right way would probably be something like:
convert to PurePosixPath before serialization convert to PosixPath or WindowsPath after deserialization, depending on OS.
